Description: Company knowingly maintained inaccurate oil and gas volume information pertaining to 953 royalty and/or production reports on 35 leases for as many as 22 months.
Agency: Interior Department Office of Natural Resources Revenue

Description: The Department of Justice and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced a settlement with QEP Field Services Co., formerly Questar Gas Management Co., to resolve alleged violations of the Clean Air Act at five natural gas compressor stations on the Uintah and Ouray Reservation in Northeastern Utah. Four members of the Ute Indian Tribe intervened as co-plaintiffs. Under the proposed settlement, QEPFS will pay a $3.65 million civil penalty and pay $350,000 into a Tribal Clean Air Trust Fund to be established by the tribal member intervenors. The settlement also requires QEPFS to reduce its emissions by removing certain equipment, installing additional pollution controls, and replacing the natural gas powered instrument control systems with compressed air control systems.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department

Notes: Penalty includes a $17,500 supplemental environmental project

Agency: South Coast (CA) Air Quality Management District
